excerpt: Elegant Beaux-Arts building, made famous in film and literature, with upscale casino & performances.
detail_description: The Casino de Monte-Carlo is an elegant Beaux-Arts building that has gained fame through its appearances in film and literature. It offers upscale casino gaming, including blackjack, baccarat, roulette, and slot machines. The casino is housed in a stunningly majestic 1800s building with turrets and cupolas that give it the appearance of a palace.
name: Casino de Monte-Carlo

excerpt: Prince of Monaco's 13th-century residence, with lavish state apartments open to public seasonally.
detail_description: The Prince's Palace of Monaco, a 13th-century residence, offers lavish state apartments that are open to the public seasonally. Monaco provides a stunning backdrop for romantic experiences, such as proposals, with its Mediterranean coastline and glamorous attractions like the Monte Carlo Casino. The palace is often included in sightseeing tours and shore excursions that also visit other historic sites and landmarks in Monaco. Visitors can enjoy breathtaking views from the palace terrace while admiring Port Hercule.
name: Prince's Palace of Monaco

excerpt: This grand, famous opera house which opened its doors in 1879 features ornate architectural details.
detail_description: The Opéra de Monte-Carlo, built in 1879 by Charles Garnier, is a grand and famous opera house known for its ornate architectural details. It has been a prominent venue for lyrical art in Europe for over 140 years, hosting renowned operas and performers such as Enrico Caruso, Roberto Alagna, Leyla Gencer, Cecilia Bartoli, and even the iconic singer Prince.
name: Opéra de Monte-Carlo

excerpt: This popular, artificial beach features clear waters, a volleyball court & a scenic promenade.
detail_description: Larvotto Beach is a popular man-made beach in Monaco, offering clear waters and a scenic promenade. It features twin coves with over 1,300 feet of pebbled shores along Avenue Princesse Grace. Visitors can enjoy beachside eateries, a playground area, watersports rentals, and a beach volleyball court. The shallow waters make it ideal for kids, and the beach is equipped with facilities, bars, and restaurants nearby.
name: Larvotto Beach

excerpt:
Jardin Exotique is the westernmost ward in the Principality of Monaco. It is incorporated in the traditional quarter of La Condamine.
Jardin Exotique ward was created in 2013, from the Les Révoires and La Colle wards, as part of an overall re-redistricting at that time. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Jardin Exotique is a residential district in Monaco, located in the northwestern part of the country. It is known for its terraced botanical gardens that offer stunning views of the Principality and the Mediterranean Sea. The area also includes Princess Antoinette Park, Monaco's hospital, and the New National Museum of Monaco Villa Paloma. Jardin Exotique has a population figure of 14 percent and an average price per square meter of 34,915.
name: Jardin Exotique

excerpt: Intimate garden featuring Japanese-style landscaping around a pond with a bridge & a tea house.
detail_description: Nestled in the vibrant heart of Monte Carlo, the Princess Grace Japanese Garden is a tranquil escape that beautifully marries traditional Japanese landscaping with Mediterranean charm. Spanning around 7,000 square meters, this serene oasis was crafted by esteemed landscape architect Yasuo Beppu and opened its doors in 1994. Visitors can wander along picturesque paths that wind around a peaceful pond adorned with koi fish, cross charming bridges, and find solace in a quaint tea house.
name: Princess Grace Japanese Garden

excerpt: Monte Carlo is an official administrative area of Monaco, specifically the ward of Monte Carlo/Spélugues, where the Monte Carlo Casino is located. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Monte Carlo, an administrative area of Monaco, is famous for the iconic Monte Carlo Casino and the Princes Palace adorned with Italian Renaissance frescoes. This glamorous destination has long attracted European jet setters and Hollywood royalty. While it's often visited as a day trip or stop on a cruise, Monte Carlo is now more accessible to travelers looking for longer stays.
name: Monte Carlo

excerpt: Monaco, officially the Principality of Monaco, is a sovereign city-state and microstate on the French Riviera a few kilometres west of the Italian region of Liguria, in Western Europe, on the Mediterranean Sea. It is a semi-enclave bordered by France to the north, east and west. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Monaco, also known as the Principality of Monaco, is a small sovereign city-state located on the French Riviera in Western Europe. It sits just a few kilometers west of Liguria, Italy and is bordered by France to the north, east, and west. The oldest district of Monaco is Monaco-Ville, which is situated on a high promontory and commonly referred to as Le Rocher (the rock).
name: Monaco

excerpt: Peaceful, terraced public gardens featuring Mediterranean flora, statuary & views of the sea.
detail_description: Jardins Saint-Martin is a serene and picturesque public garden with terraced levels, offering stunning views of the Mediterranean Sea. Established in 1830, the garden is adorned with a variety of Mediterranean and tropical plants, as well as a charming pond teeming with carp. Visitors can admire the iconic statue of Prince Albert commanding his ship at the lower level while enjoying a postcard-worthy view of the museum against the backdrop of the French Riviera coastline.
name: Jardins Saint-Martin

excerpt: Museum founded by navigator/oceanographer Prince Albert I, plus an aquarium with 6000 specimens.
detail_description: Perched dramatically on a cliffside, the Musee Oceanographique de Monaco was established by Prince Albert I and has been captivating visitors since 1910. The museum boasts an impressive aquarium featuring 6000 specimens, including sharks, tropical fish, and Mediterranean species housed in ninety tanks. It serves as a tribute to the prince's contributions to oceanography and marine biology. Additionally, visitors can enjoy stunning panoramic views of Monaco and the Mediterranean from the rooftop terrace.
name: Musée océanographique de Monaco

excerpt: Open-air display of cacti & other succulent plants native to dry zones around the world.
detail_description: The Exotic Garden of Monaco, also known as Jardin Exotique, is a hidden gem that showcases a stunning open-air display of cacti and succulent plants from dry zones worldwide. Perched on a rocky promontory at the north-western entrance of Monaco, it offers breathtaking views over the entire principality. The garden's unique location adds to its charm, drawing visitors to admire the diverse plant species while enjoying panoramic vistas of the Rock of Monaco and the Mediterranean coastline.
name: Exotic Garden of Monaco

excerpt: Luxury sailboats & yachts are showcased in this scenic, deep-water port in use since ancient times.
detail_description: Port Hercule, located in the heart of Monaco's Condamine neighborhood, is a historic deep-water port that has been in use since ancient times. It is known for showcasing luxury sailboats and yachts and is the only deep-water port in Monaco. The port hosts high-end events like the annual Monaco Yacht Show and offers convenient access to transportation, supermarkets, and leisure amenities.
name: Port Hercule

excerpt: Upscale shopping center with a luxurious feel, including marble floors & a crystal chandelier.
detail_description: Metropole Shopping Monte-Carlo is an upscale shopping center located opposite the Casino Gardens, offering a luxurious and warm ambiance with marble floors and stunning crystal chandeliers. With 80 shops and 6 restaurants, it's a perfect destination for a full day of shopping. The center features a wide selection of fashion items, accessories, gourmet food, jewelry, luxury watches, beauty care products, home decoration items, and tableware brands.
name: Metropole Shopping Monte-Carlo

excerpt: Stadium hosting home games of AS Monaco & the national team, with capacity of more than 18,000.
detail_description: Louis II Stadium, the national football stadium of Monaco and home to AS Monaco, offers a capacity of over 18,000. The stadium was rebuilt in the 1980s and is known for its rich history. While some visitors find the concourse a bit tired and seating cramped, it remains a great venue with an electric atmosphere during matches. The picturesque backdrop of mountains adds to the charm, making it a favorite among fans.
name: Stade Louis II

excerpt: Early 18th-century fort with sea views, now home to open-air theater performances in the summer.
detail_description: Perched on the Rock of Monaco, Fort Antoine Theatre is a historic 18th-century fort that has been transformed into an open-air theater. Originally built as a fortress to protect Monaco during the Spanish War of Succession, it was reconstructed after being destroyed in World War II. The theater now hosts cultural performances amidst lush gardens and offers stunning views of the Mediterranean Sea. This serene venue beautifully combines art and history, making it a must-visit destination for travelers seeking both tranquility and artistic experiences.
name: Théâtre du Fort Antoine

excerpt: This spacious museum showcases a wide range of Prince Rainier III's high-end, vintage automobiles.
detail_description: The Private Cars Collection of HSH Prince of Monaco is a spacious museum that showcases a remarkable array of vintage automobiles once owned by Prince Rainier III. The collection boasts nearly 100 classic cars, including prestigious models from Maserati, Jaguar, Mercedes, and Rolls-Royce, as well as iconic vehicles like the De Dion-Bouton 1903, Ford A 1930, Delage 1934, and Lincoln 1928.
name: Private Cars Collection of HSH Prince of Monaco

detail_description: Le Marché de la Condamine, also known as La Condamine Market, is a traditional marketplace in Monaco where local market gardeners have been selling fresh produce for centuries. The vibrant stalls under red and yellow parasols offer a feast for the senses, with an array of fruits, vegetables, and local specialties like Barbajuan, Pissaladiere, and Socca.
name: Marché de La Condamine

excerpt: Promontory overlooking Monaco’s port, with many historic buildings & walking routes.
detail_description: The Rock of Monaco, also known as the Old Town, is a historic promontory overlooking the port of Monaco. Visitors can explore its narrow medieval passages and discover landmarks such as St. Nicolas Cathedral, the Chapel of Mercy, and the Palace of Justice. The Place du Palais offers a chance to witness the Changing of the Guard at 11:55 am daily. Additionally, tourists can tour the iconic Prince's Palace and observe the Changing of the Guard ceremony.
name: Rock of Monaco

excerpt: Monaco's casino & upscale restaurants surround this well-known plaza that is home to live events.
detail_description: Casino Square is a famous plaza in Monaco, surrounded by the upscale Monte Carlo Casino and high-end restaurants. It's a popular spot for live events and people-watching, offering glimpses of the lavish lifestyle and expensive cars that frequent the area. Many sightseeing tours include a stop at Casino Square along with other historic sites like the Princes Palace and landmarks such as the Formula 1 Grand Prix track.
name: Place du Casino

excerpt: Traditional fare served in an elegant brasserie that has art nouveau-style decor & a roomy terrace.
detail_description: Café de Paris Monte-Carlo is an elegant brasserie with art nouveau-style decor and a spacious terrace. The establishment recently celebrated its 150th anniversary with a renovation overseen by the renowned Moinard Betaille firm, known for their work at prestigious venues such as Relais Plaza Athenee and Fondation Cartier.
name: Café de Paris Monte-Carlo

excerpt: Rock-sheltered, redeveloped port area with a 275-boat marina overlooked by restaurants & shops.
detail_description: Port de Fontvieille is a redeveloped area with a 275-boat marina, surrounded by restaurants and shops. It offers beautiful views and a quieter atmosphere compared to other places in Monaco. The port is known for its stunning sunrise views and welcoming locals. Visitors can enjoy the sight of luxurious yachts, expensive cars, and fine dining while taking a leisurely walk around the area.
name: Port de Fontvieille
address: Quai des Sanbarbani, 98000 Mónaco/Monte Carlo, Monaco

detail_description: If you're seeking a more peaceful alternative to the bustling Port Hercule in Monaco, look no further than the serene Port de Fontvieille. Nestled in the eponymous district, this marina offers a tranquil atmosphere and picturesque views of the harbor and Mediterranean Sea. Whether you're a yacht owner or a casual visitor, you'll appreciate the well-maintained facilities and excellent service.
name: Port de Fontvieille

detail_description: The Monaco Grand Prix Ticket offers a thrilling experience for both car racing enthusiasts and those who simply want to soak up the atmosphere. The event takes place in late May or early June, allowing spectators to witness the world's fastest racing cars zooming through the city streets of Monaco. Beyond the race itself, attendees can indulge in the extravagance of Monaco, with opportunities to purchase souvenirs at various price points.
name: Monaco Grand Prix Ticket

detail_description: Portier is a renowned destination for sports enthusiasts, hosting prestigious events like the Monaco Grand Prix, Monte-Carlo International Jumping, Herculis Diamond League Athletics Meeting, and Monte-Carlo Rolex Masters. The legendary Stade Louis II offers Ligue 1 matches featuring stars like Falcao and Lemar. Visitors staying at Quality Hotel Menton Mediterranee can easily access these major sporting events in the Principality of Monaco.
name: Portier - Monaco Grand Prix

excerpt: Modern conference & cultural center, with flexible spaces & 3 auditoria, with music, dance & art.
detail_description: Grimaldi Forum in Monaco is a modern conference and cultural center with flexible spaces and three auditoria that host music, dance, and art events. It also serves as a venue for various activities suitable for the entire family, including art exhibitions, ballets, operas, and concerts. The center offers educational workshops for kids aged 5 to 12 based on its landmark exhibitions like 'Turner, the Sublime Legacy.'
name: Grimaldi Forum

excerpt: Romanesque Catholic cathedral dedicated to Saint Nicholas, dating from the 19th century.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Monaco, the Cathédrale de Monaco stands as a stunning example of Romanesque architecture dedicated to Saint Nicholas. This magnificent cathedral, which serves as the seat of the Bishop of Monaco, was built in gratitude for Saint Nicholas's legendary act of saving sailors from perilous waters.
name: Cathédrale de Monaco
address: 4 Rue Colonel Bellando de Castro, 98000 Monaco

excerpt: National museum in a restored 4-story villa with original decor & terraced Italianate gardens.
detail_description: Nestled in the picturesque setting of Monaco, the New National Museum of Monaco - Villa Paloma is a captivating destination that art enthusiasts should not overlook. Housed within a beautifully restored four-story villa, this museum showcases original decor and features stunning terraced Italianate gardens that enhance its charm. While many visitors may miss out on exploring the nearby Jardin Exotique due to its remote location, those who venture there are rewarded with breathtaking views over Monaco's landscape.
name: New National Museum of Monaco - Villa Paloma

detail_description: Moneghetti is a charming district located on the eastern slope of Monaco, featuring winding roads and endless steps that provide access to the area from Tete de Chien to Moyenne Corniche. This part of town is characterized by its terraced layout, adorned with beautiful villas and gardens, offering visitors a picturesque setting to explore.
name: Moneghetti

excerpt: Renowned 11th-century Catholic chapel dedicated to Saint Devota, the patron saint of Monaco.
detail_description: Église de Sainte-Dévote is an 11th-century Catholic chapel in Monaco dedicated to Saint Devota, the patron saint of the country. The chapel offers a rich history and has undergone several renovations over the centuries, resulting in a captivating blend of architectural styles. It holds great significance as the bride of the Sovereign Prince traditionally places her bouquet there after the wedding ceremony. While dogs are not allowed within the church grounds, visitors can enjoy its rocky and flowery surroundings.
name: Église de Sainte-Dévote

excerpt: Gallery featuring small-scale models of sailing vessels, from wooden ships to modern cruise liners.
detail_description: The Monaco Naval Museum is a captivating destination that offers visitors a journey through maritime history. Founded by Prince Albert, this museum showcases an impressive collection of naval artifacts and models, spanning from ancient Roman ships to modern cruise liners. Situated in Les Terrasses de Fontvieille, the museum features two expansive exhibition halls as well as an outdoor site displaying objects from various international collections.
name: Monaco Naval Museum
address: Terrasses de Fontvieille, niveau 2, Av. Albert II, 98000 Monaco

excerpt: Small 17th-century chapel & museum exhibiting old masters against an elaborate baroque backdrop.
detail_description: Chapelle de la Visitation, located in Monaco, is a 17th-century chapel turned museum that showcases an impressive collection of religious art and relics. Originally built by Prince Charles III for his wife's private prayers, the museum now houses sacred treasures including works by renowned artists such as Rubens, Zurbaran, Ribera, and Italian Baroque masters. The museum offers visitors a glimpse into the extravagant lifestyle of the French Riviera through its opulent displays and elaborate baroque backdrop.
name: Chapelle de la Visitation

excerpt: Anthropology museum with a collection of fossils & prehistoric artifacts from surrounding areas.
detail_description: The Monaco Museum of Prehistoric Anthropology is a captivating attraction for history enthusiasts and families visiting the Jardin Exotique de Monaco. Founded to preserve anthropological remains discovered during Monaco's construction, the museum showcases a remarkable collection of prehistoric artifacts and fossils. Visitors can marvel at fossilized remains such as a wooly mammoth skeleton and a 2000-year-old male corpse, offering insights into human evolution during glacial and interglacial periods.
name: Monaco Museum of Prehistoric Anthropology
address: 56 bis Bd du Jardin Exotique, 98000 Monaco

excerpt: Quaint local zoo featuring a variety of exotic & domestic species in lush surrounds.
detail_description: Jardin Animalier de Monaco is a charming local zoo that was established in 1954 by Prince Rainier, inspired by his trip to Africa. It is located near the royal palace and houses a variety of exotic and domestic species. The zoo aims to provide a comfortable environment for the animals, with some being relocated when necessary. While it may be small in size, it offers an affordable visit and the option to combine tickets with other attractions like the car museum or aquarium.
name: Jardin Animalier de Monaco

excerpt: Fancy, late-night casino featuring many slot machines, 2 outdoor patios & table games.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Monte Carlo, alongside the iconic Casino de Monte-Carlo, Casino Café de Paris is a renowned late-night destination. Boasting 480 modern slot machines and an array of table games like Blackjack, Punto Banco, French roulette, American roulette, and Texas Hold'em, this casino offers ample gaming options. The recently refurbished interior features a futuristic design with neon accents and a sci-fi theme.
name: Casino Café de Paris

excerpt: High-end sporty yacht club established by Prince Rainier III in 1953 with around 2,000 members.
detail_description: The Monaco Yacht Club, established by Prince Rainier III in 1953, is a high-end sporty club with around 2,000 members. It is located at Quai des Etats-Unis and offers a fantastic view of the celebrated Yacht Club de Monaco. The area also features the Route de la Piscine with its open-air swimming pool and hosts events like the Monaco Grand Prix.
name: Monaco Yacht Club

detail_description: Buddha-Bar Monte-Carlo, located in Monaco, offers an exotic and vibrant atmosphere for visitors to unwind. The venue features a jazzy ambiance at Le Bar Americain and a relaxing terrace perfect for enjoying food and drinks while listening to live piano music. Additionally, the Cafe de Paris Monte-Carlo provides a bistro feel at its temporary location in the Salle Empire of the Hotel de Paris Monte-Carlo.
name: Buddha-Bar Monte-Carlo

detail_description: Roseraie Princesse Grace is a beautifully maintained rose garden built in memory of Princess Grace. The garden is free to enter, wheelchair accessible, and features public toilets on site. Visiting in mid-April offers the chance to see many roses and other flowers in bloom or budding along serene, well-tended walking paths. In May, the garden is in full bloom with a fantastic variety of flowers, fountains, art, and more to explore.
name: Roseraie Princesse Grace

detail_description: In Monaco, cultural experiences go beyond the luxurious lifestyle. Among the renowned performing companies in the area are Les Ballets de Monte-Carlo, known for their diverse choreographic repertoire. The Orchestre Philharmonique de Monte-Carlo offers year-round performances of lyric and symphony compositions, while the Opera de Monte-Carlo showcases powerful singers under the gilded ceiling of Salle Garnier.
name: Les Ballets de Monte-Carlo

excerpt: Signature cocktails, champagnes & classic French bites at an iconic, 1920s-inspired hotel bar.
detail_description: Le Bar Américain is an iconic 1920s-inspired hotel bar that offers signature cocktails, champagnes, and classic French bites. The venue exudes a clubby comfort with leather armchairs, honey-toned lighting, and intimate live jazz. It has been frequented by visiting celebrities and distinguished world leaders for decades. The terrace provides a perfect setting to enjoy food or sip on drinks while listening to live piano tunes.
name: Le Bar Américain

excerpt: La Condamine is the central ward and a quartier in the Principality of Monaco. The quartier's landmarks include Port Hercules, the Rainier III Nautical Stadium, and the Princess Antoinette Park. Its farmers' market, at Place d'Armes, has been held since 1880. Wikipedia.
detail_description: La Condamine, located in the heart of Monaco, is a vibrant neighborhood known for its iconic landmarks such as Port Hercules and the Rainier III Nautical Stadium. The area also boasts the charming Princess Antoinette Park and a historic farmer's market at Place d'Armes, which has been a source of local pride since 1880 for its authentic Monegasque atmosphere.
name: La Condamine

excerpt: Fontvieille is the southernmost ward in the Principality of Monaco. It was developed by Italian engineer Gianfranco Gilardini and designed by architect Manfredi Nicoletti, between the 1970s and the 1990s. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Fontvieille, located in the southernmost part of Monaco, was developed by Italian engineer Gianfranco Gilardini and architect Manfredi Nicoletti. The area offers a 3.6 km coastal path from Plage Marquet to Plage de la Mala, providing stunning views and a pleasant walk accessible by car or on foot from Monaco train station. Visitors are advised to bring suncream and water due to limited shade and warm temperatures during summer.
name: Fontvieille

detail_description: Neptune Monaco Beach is a luxurious beach club and restaurant located on the beautiful beaches of Monaco, offering stunning views of the Mediterranean. The venue provides a relaxing atmosphere where guests can enjoy delicious food while feeling the sea breeze. With comfortable seating options both indoors and outdoors, visitors can savor a small yet diverse menu that includes Italian cuisine with hints of Asian, Middle Eastern, and French fusion elements. The attentive staff ensures fast service and offers recommendations from the wine list to complement the delectable dishes.
name: Neptune Monaco Beach

excerpt: Opulent facility featuring a seawater pool with Mediterranean views, plus spa treatments & a gym.
detail_description: Thermes Marins Monte-Carlo is a luxurious facility offering a variety of wellness and fitness amenities. Guests can enjoy the immense heated saltwater pool with stunning Mediterranean views, as well as a solarium, jacuzzi, sauna, and hammam in the Wellness Space. For those seeking activity, there are options like Aqua Cardio Boxing, fitness classes, stretching, and pool Pilates.
name: Thermes Marins Monte-Carlo

detail_description: Blue Gin is a trendy and upscale bar located in the Monte-Carlo Bay Hotel, offering both indoor and outdoor seating with stunning views of Europe's beautiful coastlines. The bar provides a perfect spot for enjoying creative drinks and tasty snacks while taking in the panoramic oceanfront view, making it an ideal place to catch the sunset. Visitors can expect excellent service, delicious food, and a pleasant atmosphere with live music. Additionally, guests can enjoy shisha and ice cream while taking sensible precautions due to coronavirus.
name: Blue Gin

detail_description: One Monte-Carlo is a luxurious destination located in the heart of Monaco, offering an array of experiences for visitors. Indulge in exquisite Japanese cuisine at the renowned Yoshi restaurant, designed by architect Didier Gomez and awarded with a Michelin star. After dining, explore the adjacent shopping center opposite the Casino de Monte-Carlo, featuring stunning contemporary architecture and upscale boutiques. Additionally, guests can enjoy cultural events such as concerts and performances as part of Printemps des Arts.
name: One Monte-Carlo

detail_description: Hercule Monaco Cruise Harbor, also known as Port Hercules, is a glamorous and exclusive playground for the world's elite. It has evolved from a natural harbor into a modern hub for maritime activity and is home to the prestigious Yacht Club de Monaco. The harbor attracts luxury seekers, yacht enthusiasts, and cultural explorers who come to admire the impressive yachts owned by prominent figures such as Prince Albert II of Monaco.
name: Hercule Monaco Cruise Harbor

excerpt: Intimate garden featuring Japanese-style landscaping around a pond with a bridge & a tea house.
detail_description: Nikka Yuko Japanese Garden is a serene and enchanting traditional garden that offers visitors a glimpse into the beauty of nature and harmony. The meticulously designed landscape features delicate flowers, flowing waterfalls, charming bridges, and carefully pruned shrubs, all reflecting the essence of Japanese aesthetics. As you wander through the garden, you'll experience a sense of tranquility and equilibrium, making it an ideal setting for relaxation, meditation, and appreciation of natural splendor.
name: Princess Grace Japanese Garden

detail_description: Discover the opulent Monte Carlo Beach Club, located on the stunning Avenue Princesse Grace in Monaco. This exclusive retreat offers breathtaking ocean vistas and is more than just a beach destination; it's a portal to sophisticated leisure. Indulge in exquisite culinary experiences at Bar Glacier, where Chef Nicola impresses with top-notch cuisine and impeccable service. Immerse yourself in the high-class ambiance of this prestigious club for an unforgettable escape by the sea.
name: Monte Carlo Beach Club

detail_description: AS Monaco Basket is a prominent sports team in Monaco, known for hosting home matches at the Stade Louis II as part of the Ligue 1 championship. In addition to basketball, the stadium also hosts events like Meeting d'Athletisme Herculis EBS and Jumping International de Monte-Carlo. The team's presence adds to the vibrant atmosphere of Monaco, offering visitors a chance to enjoy top-tier sports and entertainment while exploring the beautiful beaches and exquisite dining options in the area.
name: AS Monaco Basket
address: AS Monaco, Ball S.A, 9 Av. des Castelans, 98000, Monaco

detail_description: Fontaine à eau potable jardin japonais is a delightful discovery nestled in the stunning French Riviera. Located on a steep hillside in Monaco, this authentic Japanese garden beautifully mimics the tranquility of a Zen garden with its use of water, stones, bamboo hedges, and meticulously pruned Mediterranean trees. The atmosphere exudes harmony and serenity, offering visitors a peaceful retreat within this picturesque setting.
name: Fontaine à eau potable jardin japonais
address: Princess Grace Japanese Garden, 5 Av. Princesse Grâce, 98000 Monaco
